quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Dinosaurs and Word
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, reptile, books. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The name brontosaurus is derived from the Greek words sauros, which means lizard, combined with another word. What does the word bronte mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thunder or roar

questions.question: In the book Jurassic Park, the fictional island Isla Nublar, where recreated dinosaur species live, is situated in which part of the world?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Near Costa Rica

questions.question: Name the prehistoric reptile of the late Jurassic and Cretaceous period with featherless wing membrane.  It is believed this reptile flew.
According to history/science/geology, dinosaurs became extinct approximately how many years ago?
What is the common name for the pigeon that we see in the city streets and in our backyards?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rock Dove

questions.question: The word dinosaur is a combination of two Greek words. One word  means lizard. What does the other word mean?
Dinosaurs lived during which geologic era?
Dinosaurs once roamed Colorado and Wyoming.
Name the theropod dinosaur with a long head, flat snout, and large sickle-shaped claw on the second toe of each foot.
Which of these books about prehistoric animals and dinosaurs was written by Arthur Conan Doyle?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Lost World

questions.question: This reptile, endemic to new Zealand, is the only surviving rhynchocephalian.
In the 1980s, who voiced the character of Dino, the pet dinosaur in the animated series The Flintstones?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mel Blanc

questions.question: Which of these dinosaurs had dorsal plates and spikes?
Which one of these movies tells the story of Littlefoot, an Apatosaurus in search of the Great Valley where dinosaurs can live in peace?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Land Before Time

questions.question: The species Tyrannosaurus Rex  was herbivorous.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Dinosaurs and Dinosaur
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, cartoon, kind. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Fossils of a Velociraptor attacking a Protoceratops, proving that dinosaurs attacked and ate each other, were discovered in which part of the world in 1971?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Gobi Desert

questions.question: What is the meaning of the term Triceratops, referring to a dinosaur genus discovered in 1888 in North America?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Three horns on the face

questions.question: In the scientific classification of animals, what does the term Dinosauria signify?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A superorder

questions.question: Which one of these dinosaurs was herbivorous?
Which one of these dinosaurs was carnivorous?
What kind of celestial body is the 9949 Brontosaurus?
The first evidence of herding behaviour among dinosaurs was discovered in 1878 in which part of the world?
In the cartoon Dinosaucers, Bronto Thunder is what kind of dinosaur?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An evolved Apatosaurus

questions.question: The design of the Japanese fictional monster Godzilla was based on the characteristics of which dinosaur?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: The BBC series Walking with Dinosaurs, which won three Emmy Awards, consisted of how many parts?
What is Dinotopia, the fictional place where humans and dinosaurs live together in James Gurneys books and Hallmarks mini series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A hidden island

questions.question: No dinosaur fossils have been found on which one of these continents?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: How many fingers did the Tyrannosaurus rex have on its forelimbs?
Which one of these dinosaurs was bigger than a dog?
Which band recorded a song called Brontosaurus which includes the following verse:

options.text: d he seemed to lose control

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Elephants and Elephant
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, mammoths, brain. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Elephants always give birth to twins.
How many individual muscles are in an elephants trunk?
Elephants intertwine their trunks with the trunks of other elephants, much like a handshake. What does an elephant not do with its trunk?

options.text: drink through it like through a straw
grab enemies and fling them away

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: drink through it like through a straw

questions.question: Elephants spend 16 hours a day collecting and eating food, an average of 400 lbs of food a day. But their bodies do not digest 100% of the food. How much of the food does the elephants body digest?
An elephants brain is half the size of the human brain.
Until what age can the female elephant (called a cow) produce offspring?
Elephants sometimes have stillborn births, but are not bothered by the loss since the baby was never alive.
Which one of these statements about the Seismosaurus, the Earth-shaking lizard, is wrong?

options.text: It could reach 33 meters in length.
It was recognized as a species in 1991.
Its hind legs were shorter than its front legs.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Its hind legs were shorter than its front legs.

questions.question: Elephants express joy by spinning in circles, trumpeting, roaring, screaming, urinating, and flapping their ears. In which of these cases will an elephant not act this way?

options.text: when meeting a friend (elephant or human)
after the death of an elderly elephant
after the birth of a new baby elephant

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: after the death of an elderly elephant

questions.question: Mammoths are members of the elephant family.
It has been reported that in the period 1992-2008, Ringling Bros. and Barnum  Bailey Circus had at least this many elephant deaths caused by abuse and neglect.
Just like humans, apes and dolphins, elephants can recognize themselves in a mirror.
How long is the average lifespan of an elephant?
How many species of elephant exist today?
When swimming, an elephant will use its trunk as a snorkel.

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Animals and Elephants
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, reef, bird. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: An elephants tusks grow continuously, about 7 inches a year.
Echidnas can swim.
Which of these animals is NOT native to Australia?
Which is true about elephants?

options.text: The elephant is a good jumper.
The elephant is not a protected species.
An elephants skin is 2.5 inches thick.
The elephant is a good swimmer.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The elephant is a good swimmer.

questions.question: Only female elephants were used in battle, because male elephants were too difficult to tame and train.
This reef, that extends along the east coast of Australia, is home to countless animals and is considered one of the wonders of the natural world.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Great Barrier Reef

questions.question: The echidnas diet consists mainly of this group of animals.
In Islamic history, 570 A.D. was The Year of the Elephant. Which of these happened in that year?

options.text: The Qur’an was written in book form

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Muhammad was born

questions.question: Through what body part can an elephant NOT hear?
Salt water crocodiles belong to the amphibian group.
What does the word Triceratops mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Three Horned Face

questions.question: Where does the kookaburra, a common Australian bird, get its name from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The aboriginal name for it

questions.question: Which one of these is NOT a type of wombat?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arid Central

questions.question: The female of this species is sometimes called a Blue Flyer, because of its bluish coloration.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: red kangaroo

questions.question: What is the only marsupial in the world that has a backwards pouch?

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Mantis and Triceratops
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, birds, s. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: It is thought that Triceratops was able to run how fast?
The praying mantis lives only up to one year.
Female mantes (the plural for mantis) are larger than males.
Is there any evidence that Triceratops lived in herds?
What does the word “mantis” mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Prophet or fortuneteller

questions.question: The proper spelling of this insect’s name is preying mantis even though it is commonly referred to as praying mantis.
Can a praying mantis change color?
In what year was the Praying mantis placed on the Endangered Species List?
In what year was Triceratops first discovered?
Triceratops is the official State Dinosaur of which state?
A large mantis can feed on birds or small mammals.
You can go to jail for intentionally killing a praying mantis as it is an endangered species.
Triceratops was a voracious meat eater and would consume hundreds of pounds of meat a day.
How much is Triceratops thought to have weighed?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Between 13,000 and 26,000 lbs

questions.question: Triceratops fossils have been found on three continents.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Stegosaurus and Tiger
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, brain, nowadays. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the meaning of the name Stegosaurus?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roof Lizard

questions.question: Stegosaurus had a brain about the size of an orange.
The Stegosaurus had no teeth.
The spikes on the tail of a Stegosaurus are called “thagomizers” and are a reference to the Gary Larsons comic strip Far Side.
How many subspecies of the tiger are left nowadays?
What was the average height of a stegosaurus?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 9 feet (2.7 m)

questions.question: What was the average weight of a Stegosaurus?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 6,800 lbs. (3 tonnes)

questions.question: Stegosaurus had back legs that were twice as long as its front legs.
The Sumatran tiger is the smallest of all tigers.
Is the tiger the largest cat out of the Big Cat group?
Stegosaurus had the strongest front legs in the dinosaur world.
What was the length of an average Stegosaurus?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 26-30 feet (8-9.2 m)

questions.question: The Caspian tiger is believed to have become extinct.
Did the Stegosaurus have more bones in its tail than any other Jurassic Dinosaur?
How many bony plates did a Stegosaurus have embedded on its back?
